intro: Burtonia diosmifolia, commonly known as the white-flowered burtonia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, silky hair. Burtonia diosmifolia typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas with high humidity.
